intro: Houstonia faxonorum, commonly known as the Faxon's bluemink, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant produces small, delicate blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
